actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned pursuant to a previous special order. The next meeting is scheduled for 10:00 a.m. on July 28, 2023.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Green, Al (TX) moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House resumed with Special Order speeches.

The House received a communication from The Honorable Sam Graves, Chairman, Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure. Pursuant to section 3307 of Title 40, United States Code, Mr. Graves (MO) notified the Speaker that the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure met on July 27, 2023 in open session, with a quorum being present, to consider 15 resolutions included in the General Services Administration's Capital Investment and Leasing Programs. Resolutions referred to the Committee on Appropriations.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.
Pursuant to section 3(z) of H. Res. 5, the Chair announced the Speaker's designation of the period from Friday, July 28, 2023 through Monday, September 11, 2023 as a "district work period."

actions-list.header: Director of the Congressional Budget Office
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to section 201(a)(2) of the Congressional Budget Act of 1974, and upon recommendations by the House and Senate Budget Committees, the Speaker and the Senate President pro tempore appointed: Dr. Phillip Swagel for the term expiring January 3, 2027.
The House resumed with one minute speeches.
Mr. LaMalfa asked unanimous consent that when the House adjourns today, it adjourn to meet at 10:00 a.m. on July 28. Agreed to without objection.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 220

actions-list.actionItem: The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on S.J. Res. 24.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 4366, S.J. Res. 9 and S.J. Res. 24. The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 4366, under a structured rule with one hour of general debate and a motion to recommit. The resolution provides for consideration of S.J. Res. 9 and S.J. Res. 24, under a closed rule with one hour of general debate for both joint resolutions and one motion to commit for both joint resolutions.

Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 614. S.J. Res. 24 — "Providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the United States Fish and Wildlife Service relating to "Endangered and Threatened Wildlife and Plants; Endangered Species Status for Northern Long-Eared Bat"."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 3254 — "To amend the Homeland Security Act of 2002 to establish a process to review applications for certain grants to purchase equipment or systems that do not meet or exceed any applicable national voluntary consensus standards, and for other purposes."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 1501 — "To prohibit the Secretary of Homeland Security from operating or procuring certain foreign-made unmanned aircraft systems, and for other purposes."

The Chair announced the unfinished business was the question on the motion to suspend the rules and pass H.R. 1501, as amended, and pass H.R. 3254, which had all been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.
The Clerk was authorized to correct section numbers, punctuation, and cross references, and to make other necessary technical and conforming corrections in the engrossment of H.R. 4366.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 221

actions-list.actionItem: Considered as unfinished business. S.J. Res. 9 — "Providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the United States Fish and Wildlife Service relating to "Endangered and Threatened Wildlife and Plants; Lesser Prairie-Chicken; Threatened Status with Section 4(d) Rule for the Northern Distinct Population Segment and Endangered Status for the Southern Distinct Population Segment"."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 219
On motion to recommit Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 206

actions-list.actionItem: Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 4366 — "Making appropriations for military construction, the Department of Veterans Affairs, and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2024, and for other purposes."
The Chair announced the unfinished business was the question on the motion to recommit on H.R. 4366, passage of H.R. 4366, and passage of S.J. Res. 9.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of July 27.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.

At the conclusion of debate on S. J. Res. 9, the Chair put the question on passage of the joint resolution and by voice vote, announced the ayes had prevailed. Mr. Grijalva demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on S.J. Res. 9.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 4366, S.J. Res. 9 and S.J. Res. 24. The resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 4366, under a structured rule with one hour of general debate and a motion to recommit. The resolution provides for consideration of S.J. Res. 9 and S.J. Res. 24, under a closed rule with one hour of general debate for both joint resolutions and one motion to commit for both joint resolutions.

Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 614. S.J. Res. 9 — "Providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the United States Fish and Wildlife Service relating to "Endangered and Threatened Wildlife and Plants; Lesser Prairie-Chicken; Threatened Status with Section 4(d) Rule for the Northern Distinct Population Segment and Endangered Status for the Southern Distinct Population Segment"."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches, which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 15 per side of the aisle.
The House received a message from the Senate. The Senate passed S. 546, S. 994, S. 1387, and S. 2051. Senate agreed to S. Res. 316 and H. Con. Res. 57.
The Chair designated Ms. Ross to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of July 27.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 12:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Nicholas A. Langworthy to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
